alert.note: Alert for Cass; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 7:24PM CDT until April 14 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Otoe County in southeastern Nebraska... Central Cass County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 723 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Louisville, or 14 miles south of Gretna, moving northeast at 30 mph. This replaces the warning currently in effect for Cass and Otoe counties that expires at 730 PM. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. These storms have a history of producing half dollar to golf ball sized hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Louisville around 735 PM CDT. Cedar Creek around 740 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
